    • getUserByToken

      public Users getUserByToken(String token)
      The getUserByToken method is used to find users associated to a specific token provided.
      Parameters:
      token - The auto generated token that is assigned to a user once he request for a password reset or after he registers
      Returns:
      It returns the the details of the particular user associated to the token.

    • registerUser

      public Users registerUser(AuthenticationRequest authenticationRequest)
      The register user method first checks whether a user is present and throws UserAlreadyExistException if the user exists else it creates an account for the user.
      Specified by:
      registerUser in interface UserService
      Parameters:
      authenticationRequest - It requires an authentication request which contains the details of the user who wants to create the account
      Returns:
      It returns the user entity after the account has been created successfully.

    • checkUser

      public Users checkUser(String email)
      The checkUser method is a method that checks whether a user is exist in the users table and also whether the user's account is not already verified. The method is invoked when the user request the verification email to be resent to them.
      Parameters:
      email - The email of the user who wants the verification token resent to them.
      Returns:
      It returns the user entity if and only if the user exist.

    • getUserForReset

      public Users getUserForReset(String email)
      The getUserForReset() method is used to retrieve the user entity from the user's table so that a reset password verification token can be sent to them.
      Parameters:
      email - The email of the user who wants to initiate the reset password function
      Returns:
      The user entity if found.

    • verifyUser

      public boolean verifyUser(String email)
      Verifies if a user with the given email exists and is enabled.
      Parameters:
      email - The email address of the user to be verified.
      Returns:
      true if the user exists and is enabled, false otherwise.

    • validateToken

      public String validateToken(String token)
      Validates a given verification token.
      Specified by:
      validateToken in interface UserService
      Parameters:
      token - the verification token to be validated
      Returns:
      a string indicating the validation result: "Invalid Verification Token", "Verification Token Expired", or "valid"

    • validateResetToken

      public String validateResetToken(String token)
      Validates a given password reset token.
      Parameters:
      token - the reset token to be validated
      Returns:
      a string indicating the validation result: "Invalid Verification Token", "Verification Token Expired", or "valid"

    • updatePassword

      public boolean updatePassword(String email, String password, String confirm) throws BadRequestException
      Updates the password for a given email.
      Parameters:
      email - the email of the user whose password is to be updated
      password - the new password
      confirm - the confirmation of the new password
      Returns:
      true if the password was successfully updated, false otherwise
      Throws:
      BadRequestException - if the account is not verified or if the email is empty

    • resetPasswordInit

      public String resetPasswordInit(String email, String url, String type) throws NotFoundException
      Initiates the password reset process for a given email.
      Parameters:
      email - the email of the user requesting the password reset
      url - the base URL to be used in the reset link
      type - the type of the request ("web" or "api")
      Returns:
      the generated reset link
      Throws:
      NotFoundException - if the user is not found

    • saveVerificationToken

      public void saveVerificationToken(Users user, String token)
      Saves a verification token for a given user.
      Parameters:
      user - the user for whom the verification token is to be saved
      token - the verification token to be saved

    • findToken

      public VerificationToken findToken(String token)
      Finds a verification token by its token string.
      Parameters:
      token - the token string to search for
      Returns:
      the found verification token, or null if not found
